data.title: Every Year in the History of Armenia
data.meta_description: Charting New Waters - Eocnomics, Finance, News, and General Interest Stories
data.text:
Taps Coogan – October 4th, 2020

Enjoy The Sounding Line? Click here to subscribe.

As part of our ongoing series of historical video-maps, we present: ‘Every Year in the History of Armenia,’ from YouTube creator Kayra Atakan.

Beginning in 1500 BC with the Hayasa-Azzi confederation and continuing until present day, the following video tracks the changing borders and migrations of Armenia and the Armenian people. Armenia lies in the highlands surrounding the Biblical mountains of Ararat and has found itself sandwiched between, and absorbed by, many of the most powerful empires throughout history: the Romans, the Parthians, the Mongols, the Persians, the Rashidun Caliphate, the Ottomans, the Soviets, and others.

Now a sovereign nation and a constitutional democracy, Armenia is in the midst of widespread fighting with neighboring Azerbaijan over a break-away region that ended up as part of Azerbaijan after the fall of the Soviet Union despite being ethnically Armenian. The conflict is believed to have been re-ignited by a coordinated Azerbaijan attack aimed at reasserting control over the breakaway region.
